blockingIssues.message: CommandExtractor not receiving language contexts from LanguageDetector
blockingIssues.details: Commands like 'pytest', 'go install', 'mvn install' not being detected or classified incorrectly as 'Shell' instead of proper languages

blockingIssues.message: 202 test failures out of 1238 total tests
blockingIssues.details: 25/59 CommandExtractor tests failing - language inference broken, context inheritance not working, confidence scores incorrect

blockingIssues.message: IntegrationPipeline not properly connecting LanguageDetector to CommandExtractor
blockingIssues.details: ComponentFactory dependency initialization issues preventing proper data flow between analyzers

qualityImprovements.details: Mostly unused variables, console statements, and escape character issues - can be deferred

reasoning: MAJOR PROGRESS: TypeScript compilation errors have been completely resolved! The project now compiles successfully. However, the core integration between CommandExtractor and LanguageDetector remains broken, causing 202 test failures (16.3% failure rate). The IntegrationPipeline exists but has dependency issues preventing proper component communication. Since compilation is working, we should continue fixing the integration issues rather than switching contexts.
nextAction: Fix the IntegrationPipeline ComponentFactory dependency initialization to ensure LanguageDetector contexts are properly passed to CommandExtractor. Focus on the language association and context inheritance issues.
criticalPath: Fix command language classification and context inheritance

achievements: ✅ Fixed yaml-utils undefined line handling issues
✅ Fixed command-extractor AST property access errors
progressUpdate.nextMilestone: Fix CommandExtractor integration with LanguageDetector to resolve 202 test failures
